Title.I: could have, should have, would have

GapFillInput.Instruction: Type the correct phrase from the pool in each gap.

Content.Question:
1. A: I can’t remember that lecture at all!
B: You should have taken notes.
2. A: There was a huge snake near my bed!
B: I would have been terrified!
3. A: He climbed up onto the roof.
B: That was dangerous. He could have fallen.
4. A: Jon’s absolutely furious.
B: I know. I shouldn't have told him about the car.
5. A: The film was very scary.
B: I certainly wouldn't have enjoyed it, then.
6. A: I clicked on the e-mail attachment and my computer crashed.
B: You shouldn't have opened the attachment.
7. A: Was your car badly damaged?
B: It could have been worse. I just need to replace one of the doors.
8. A: It’s a great TV but it was very expensive.
B: You should have bought it online.
9. A: Karen looks completely different.
B: Yes, I wouldn't have recognised her.
10. A: Why didn’t you build an extra bedroom?
B: It would have cost too much.
